Him. The nature of the emissive excited state was
overlap. The temperature dependence of emission lifetimes
was measured at ﬁrst time in the nitridorhenium(V) complex
nescence intensity change was accomplished by the solid-based
reactions of the complexes involving changes in the
coordination number and in the environment around the
complex. The results demonstrated that the luminescence
intensity change was controlled by the formation/dissociation
of the weak bond in the solid state.
